thread.title: China’s Yuantong Express launches cargo carrier | Finance & Data
thread.title_full: China’s Yuantong Express launches cargo carrier | Finance & Data content from ATWOnline

author: Katie Cantle
title: China’s Yuantong Express launches cargo carrier | Finance & Data
text:
Yuantong Express formally launched a cargo carrier, Yuantong Airlines, on Sept. 26 with an inaugural Hangzhou-Chengdu flight.
Yuantong Express, one of China’s largest express delivery companies, applied to the Civil Aviation Administration of China (CAAC) to launch a cargo carrier in 2013 and received formal approval in June.
The new Hangzhou-based cargo entity has a registered capital of CNY400 million ($63 million). Yuantong Express holds a 90% stake (with a CNY360 million investment) while Yuantong Express chairman Yu Huijiao and vice chairman Zhang Xiaojuan each hold a 5% share (with a CNY20 million investment, respectively).
Yuantong Airlines is expected to operate three Boeing737-300 freighters initially—one has been put into formal operation while the second and the third aircraft are scheduled to be introduced in November and December.
Over the past five years, China’s domestic express delivery market has experienced an annual growth rate of more than 30%. However, domestic carriers operate fewer than 120 freighters; only a small number are used for the express delivery market as China’s air cargo service mainly relies on using the bellyhold of passenger aircraft.
Shunfeng Express and EMS have already launched their own cargo carriers to explore the fast-growing market potential. Shunfeng Express operates a fleet of more than 30 freighters and EMS owns a fleet of more than 20 freighters.
Tianjin-based Okay Airways also plans to launch its own cargo carrier.
